contentrichtext.text: {{MedalTableTop|name=David Ford|medals= {{Medal|Sport|Men's [[slalom canoeing]]}} {{Medal|Country| {{CAN}}}} {{Medal|Comp|World Championships}} {{Medal|Gold|[[1999 ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships|1999 La Seu d'Urgell]]|K-1}} {{Medal|Silver|[[2003 ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships|2003 Augsburg]]|K-1}} }} '''David Watson Ford''' (born March 23, 1967 in [[Edmonton]]) is a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[Slalom canoeing|slalom canoeist]] who has competed since the mid-1980s. He won two medals in the K-1 event at the [[ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships]] with a gold in [[1999 ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships|1999]] and a silver in [[2003 ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships|2003]]. Ford also competed in five [[Summer Olympics]], earning his best finish of fourth in the [[Canoeing at the 2004 Summer Olympics â€“ Men's slalom K-1|K-1 event]] in [[Athens]] in [[2004 Summer Olympics|2004]]. He is the overall [[Canoe Slalom World Cup|World Cup]] champion in K-1 from [[2003 Canoe Slalom World Cup|2003]].
